Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: white slip; dot and billet pattern and dotted squares flanked by two lines around rim; below, painted decoration consisting possibly of goat horn; pendant roundel, dotted rosette, strokes and dots as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1552 and 1886,0401.1559. Whilst the iconography on the exterior of the sherd and the lack of decoration on the interior of the sherd are consistent with the Wild Goat Style, it is possible that the sherd belongs to the same vase as two other sherds which are stylistically late for the Wild Goat Style and may mark a transtion to the Mature Animal Style. In pencil on inside, 'AΠ'.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 14)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 234, no. 131)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0395) (phase 2)
